_header: Sometime there was a noble man
_description: The Seuyn Sages of Rome — in short couplets; ‘D’ text

Asloan.First Lines:
Ane empriour in tymes byganeIn Rome callit
                    dioclesiane…
Asloan.Last Lines:
…Syne ȝeid till hevyn & sa do weSays all Amen for
                    cherite
Asloan.Note:
Imperfect, 2780 lines; Nineteenth-century transcripts: Edinburgh,
                    University Lib., La.III.481 (ff. 1-); and Edinburgh, University Lib.,
                    La.IV.27/28 (item 9, incomplete).
Asloan.Attributed Title:
Heir begynis þe buke of þe sevyne sagis (f. 167); Heir endes
                    þe sevyn sages per Magistro asloan (f. 209v)
Asloan.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Asloan Manuscript.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 14, 16. Edinburgh, London: Blackwood, 1923, 192: 2.1-88.
Buuren[- Veenenbos],  C. van,
                        ed.  
             The Buke of the Sevyne Sagis: A Middle Scots Version of the Seven Sages
                of Rome, edited from the Asloan Manuscript (NLS Acc 4223), c. 1515.
         Leiden, 1982.
